This blog is now closed.Hamas could ask for revisions to Trump Gaza plan, sources and analysts sayUS government shutdown day three: Republicans and Democrats make little progress on dealTrump administration freezes $2.1bn in funds for Chicago transit projectsAs the world waits for Hamas’s response to Donald Trump’s peace plan for Gaza, the US president has issued a new deadline for the militant group of 6pm ET on Sunday.Trump, who on Monday gave Hamas “three or four days” to respond to his ultimatum, said they were being given “one last chance”. He wrote on his Truth Social platform this morning:Every Country has signed on! If this LAST CHANCE agreement is not reached, all HELL, like no one has ever seen before, will break out against Hamas. items.title: Hamas says it has agreed to parts of the Gaza peace proposal outlined by Trump
items.standfirst: The plan called for Hamas to return all Israeli hostages and for the Israeli military to begin withdrawing from parts of the Gaza Strip in phases.
items.content: The plan called for Hamas to return all Israeli hostages and for the Israeli military to begin withdrawing from parts of the Gaza Strip in phases.

items.title: Donald Trump orders Israel to ‘immediately’ stop bombing Gaza as Hamas agrees to free hostages
items.standfirst: Palestinian militant group accepts part of US president’s plan but seeks further negotiations on many termsDonald Trump ordered Israel to “immediately” stop bombing Gaza as he welcomed Hamas’s partial acceptance of his ultimatum to end the nearly two-year war.Hamas has agreed to release all hostages in return for Palestinian prisoners held in Israeli jails, as well as surrender governing power in the Gaza Strip, in accordance with Trump’s plan. Continue reading...

items.title: Donald Trump Reacts to Hamas Response to Peace Plan
items.standfirst: "Israel must immediately stop the bombing of Gaza," the president wrote on Truth Social.
items.content: "Israel must immediately stop the bombing of Gaza," the president wrote on Truth Social.

items.title: Trump orders Israel to stop bombing Gaza after Hamas accepts peace plan
items.standfirst: Hamas responded to US President Donald Trump's 20-point peace plan to end the war in Gaza on Friday, after the president issued the group an ultimatum to answer by Sunday evening. Hamas announced that it was willing to release hostages, but said some elements of the plan would need to be further discussed.
items.content: Hamas responded to US President Donald Trump's 20-point peace plan to end the war in Gaza on Friday, after the president issued the group an ultimatum to answer by Sunday evening. Hamas announced that it was willing to release hostages, but said some elements of the plan would need to be further discussed.

items.title: Hamas agrees to release hostages under Trump's Gaza plan, other points need negotiating
items.standfirst: Hamas on Friday said it was willing to release all hostages held in Gaza under the terms of US President Donald Trump's plan to end the Gaza war. Other issues in the peace proposal concerning Gaza's future and the "inalienable rights of the Palestinian people" will need further discussions involving the group's participation. The response came hours after Trump issued a Sunday night ultimatum to Hamas.
items.content: Hamas on Friday said it was willing to release all hostages held in Gaza under the terms of US President Donald Trump's plan to end the Gaza war. Other issues in the peace proposal concerning Gaza's future and the "inalienable rights of the Palestinian people" will need further discussions involving the group's participation. The response came hours after Trump issued a Sunday night ultimatum to Hamas.

items.title: Hamas says it accepts some elements of Gaza peace plan after Trump issues ultimatum
items.standfirst: Hamas said it has accepted some elements of President Trump's plan, including giving up power and releasing all remaining hostages, but that others require further consultations among Palestinians.
items.content: Hamas said it has accepted some elements of President Trump's plan, including giving up power and releasing all remaining hostages, but that others require further consultations among Palestinians.(Image credit: Abdel Kareem Hana)

items.title: Hamas agrees to release all Israeli hostages, conditions pending
items.standfirst: Hamas said it has agreed to release all Israeli hostages, alive or dead, as long as "the field conditions for the exchange are met" and expressed willingness to negotiate through mediators on President Donald Trump's plan for peace in the Middle East
items.content: Hamas said it has agreed to release all Israeli hostages, alive or dead, as long as "the field conditions for the exchange are met" and expressed willingness to negotiate through mediators on President Donald Trump's plan for peace in the Middle East

items.title: Trump tells Israel 'stop bombing Gaza' - as Hamas agrees to release Israeli hostages, and to parts of peace deal
items.standfirst: Donald Trump has said Hamas is ready for a "lasting peace" after the Palestinian militants agreed to release all remaining hostages, as he called on Israel to stop bombing Gaza.
items.content: Donald Trump has said Hamas is ready for a "lasting peace" after the Palestinian militants agreed to release all remaining hostages, as he called on Israel to stop bombing Gaza.

items.title: Hamas agrees to release hostages under Trump's Gaza plan, other points need negotiating
items.standfirst: Hamas on Friday said it was willing to release all hostages held in Gaza under the terms of US President Donald Trump's plan to end the Gaza war. Other issues in the peace proposal concerning Gaza's future and the "inalienable rights of the Palestinian people" will need further discussions involving the group's participation. The response came hours after Trump issued a Sunday night ultimatum to Hamas.

Other issues in the peace proposal concerning Gaza's future and the "inalienable rights of the Palestinian people" will need further discussions involving the group's participation. items.title: Hamas has sent out 'mixed messages' in response to Trump's peace plan
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump gave Palestinian Hamas militants until Sunday evening to accept his proposal to end the nearly two-year-old war with US ally Israel in the Gaza Strip. "There have been mixed messages from Hamas", said Noga Tarnopolsky, FRANCE 24's correspondent in Jerusalem. A Hamas military leader from Gaza said he opposed the deal, while the political leadership in Qatar said they wanted to look for gray areas, or places where a compromise could be reached, added Tarnopolsky.
items.content: US President Donald Trump gave Palestinian Hamas militants until Sunday evening to accept his proposal to end the nearly two-year-old war with US ally Israel in the Gaza Strip. "There have been mixed messages from Hamas", said Noga Tarnopolsky, FRANCE 24's correspondent in Jerusalem. A Hamas military leader from Gaza said he opposed the deal, while the political leadership in Qatar said they wanted to look for gray areas, or places where a compromise could be reached, added Tarnopolsky.

items.title: Trump tells Israel to stop bombing Gaza after Hamas agrees to release Israeli hostages
items.standfirst: Hamas said it would agree to release the remaining Israeli hostages in exchange for Palestinian prisoners. Despite not agreeing to the full U.S. peace proposal, President Trump said the group seemed ready for peace.
items.content: Hamas said it would agree to release the remaining Israeli hostages in exchange for Palestinian prisoners. Despite not agreeing to the full U.S. peace proposal, President Trump said the group seemed ready for peace. (Image credit: Bashar Taleb)

items.title: Trump sets Sunday deadline for Hamas to agree to his deal for ending the war in Gaza
items.standfirst: U.S. President Donald Trump said Friday that Hamas must agree to a proposed peace deal by Sunday evening, threatening an even greater military onslaught nearly two years into the war sparked by the Oct. 7 attack into Israel. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent in Jerusalem, Noga Tarnopolsky.
items.content: U.S. President Donald Trump said Friday that Hamas must agree to a proposed peace deal by Sunday evening, threatening an even greater military onslaught nearly two years into the war sparked by the Oct. 7 attack into Israel. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent in Jerusalem, Noga Tarnopolsky.

items.title: Egypt foreign minister urges Hamas to accept Trump Gaza plan and disarm
items.standfirst: Hamas reportedly split on response to deal as US president sets Sunday deadline for militant group to replyEgypt and Qatar are working to convince Hamas to accept Donald Trump’s ultimatum to end the war in Gaza, Egypt’s foreign minister has said, as Trump gave a Sunday deadline to reply.Badr Abdelatty said the time had come for Hamas to disarm, and that Israel should be given no excuse to continue its offensive in Gaza, where it killed another 28 Palestinians on Friday. Continue reading...
items.content: Hamas reportedly split on response to deal as US president sets Sunday deadline for militant group to replyEgypt and Qatar are working to convince Hamas to accept Donald Trump’s ultimatum to end the war in Gaza, Egypt’s foreign minister has said, as Trump gave a Sunday deadline to reply.Badr Abdelatty said the time had come for Hamas to disarm, and that Israel should be given no excuse to continue its offensive in Gaza, where it killed another 28 Palestinians on Friday. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump issues Hamas a Sunday night ultimatum to accept his Gaza peace plan
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump has given Hamas a deadline to agree to his Gaza peace plan. Trump posted on his Truth Social platform on Friday that the agreement must come before Sunday evening or else “all HELL, like no one has ever seen before, will break out”. The plan would place Gaza under a temporary governing committee led by Trump himself and former UK prime minister Tony Blair.
items.content: President Donald Trump has given Hamas a deadline to agree to his Gaza peace plan. Trump posted on his Truth Social platform on Friday that the agreement must come before Sunday evening or else “all HELL, like no one has ever seen before, will break out”. The plan would place Gaza under a temporary governing committee led by Trump himself and former UK prime minister Tony Blair.

items.title: Hamas could ask for revisions to Trump Gaza plan, sources and analysts say
items.standfirst: Turkey and Qatar putting pressure on group to make concessions – but condition it disarm is a sticking pointHamas will demand key revisions to Donald Trump’s Gaza ceasefire proposal but is likely to accept the plan in coming days as a basis for renewed negotiations, analysts and sources close to the group say.Trump imposed a deadline of “three or four days” from Tuesday for Hamas to give its response to his 20-point plan, which aims to bring the two-year war in Gaza to a close and allow an apparently indefinite international administration of the devastated territory, or “pay in hell”. Continue reading...
items.content: Turkey and Qatar putting pressure on group to make concessions – but condition it disarm is a sticking pointHamas will demand key revisions to Donald Trump’s Gaza ceasefire proposal but is likely to accept the plan in coming days as a basis for renewed negotiations, analysts and sources close to the group say.Trump imposed a deadline of “three or four days” from Tuesday for Hamas to give its response to his 20-point plan, which aims to bring the two-year war in Gaza to a close and allow an apparently indefinite international administration of the devastated territory, or “pay in hell”. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Trump ordered Israel to stop bombing Gaza after Hamas agreed to parts of the plan.
Hamas agreed to release hostages and surrender governing power in Gaza.
Hamas is seeking further negotiations on many terms of the peace plan.
Trump gave Hamas a deadline to respond to the peace plan.
The plan calls for Hamas to return hostages and Israeli withdrawal phases.

clusters.title: Sean "Diddy" Combs sentenced to over 4 years for prostitution-related charges
clusters.neutral_headline: Sean 'Diddy' Combs sentenced to over four years in prison

items.title: Sean "Diddy" Combs sentenced to over 4 years for prostitution-related charges
items.standfirst: Sean "Diddy" Combs' sentencing hearing was held three months after he was convicted ​on two prostitution-related charges.
items.content: Sean "Diddy" Combs' sentencing hearing was held three months after he was convicted ​on two prostitution-related charges.

items.title: Sean "Diddy" Combs: The Verdict
items.standfirst: A jury convicted Sean “Diddy” Combs on prostitution-related counts, but acquitted him of the more severe charges of racketeering conspiracy and sex trafficking on Wednesday, following a 7-week trial. CBS News examines the high-profile federal trial in New York, the explosive testimonies, and what led to Comb’s arrest and federal charges in the one-hour special, "Sean 'Diddy' Combs: The Verdict," hosted by Jericka Duncan.
items.content: A jury convicted Sean “Diddy” Combs on prostitution-related counts, but acquitted him of the more severe charges of racketeering conspiracy and sex trafficking on Wednesday, following a 7-week trial. CBS News examines the high-profile federal trial in New York, the explosive testimonies, and what led to Comb’s arrest and federal charges in the one-hour special, "Sean 'Diddy' Combs: The Verdict," hosted by Jericka Duncan.

items.title: Sean "Diddy" Combs: The Sentencing
items.standfirst: A judge on Friday ordered Sean "Diddy" Combs to serve 50 months in prison — just over four years — for two prostitution-related charges. Combs was also given five years of supervised release and a $500,000 fine. CBS News examines the high-profile federal trial in New York, the explosive testimonies, and what led to Comb’s arrest and federal charges in the one-hour special, "Sean Diddy Combs: The Sentencing," hosted by Jericka Duncan.
items.content: A judge on Friday ordered Sean "Diddy" Combs to serve 50 months in prison — just over four years — for two prostitution-related charges. Combs was also given five years of supervised release and a $500,000 fine. CBS News examines the high-profile federal trial in New York, the explosive testimonies, and what led to Comb’s arrest and federal charges in the one-hour special, "Sean Diddy Combs: The Sentencing," hosted by Jericka Duncan.

items.title: Music mogul Sean 'Diddy' Combs sentenced to over 4 years in prostitution case
items.standfirst: Sean "Diddy" Combs was sentenced Friday to four years and two months in federal prison after being convicted of organising drug-fueled, sometimes violent sex parties involving paid sex workers – a dramatic fall from grace for one of hip-hop's most powerful figures.
items.content: Sean "Diddy" Combs was sentenced Friday to four years and two months in federal prison after being convicted of organising drug-fueled, sometimes violent sex parties involving paid sex workers – a dramatic fall from grace for one of hip-hop's most powerful figures.

ai_summary: Sean "Diddy" Combs was sentenced to over four years in prison for prostitution-related charges.
Combs was convicted on two prostitution-related charges after a seven-week trial.
He was acquitted of racketeering conspiracy and sex trafficking charges.
Combs was also given five years of supervised release and a $500,000 fine.
Combs apologized to his mother, children, and victims in court.

ai_summary: House Republicans canceled votes, escalating the government shutdown strategy.
Democrats and Republicans rejected spending bills to reopen the government.
The Senate adjourned for the weekend, extending the shutdown into next week.
Democrats are holding out for healthcare concessions in their spending bill.
Experts warn the shutdown is causing the US to "fly blind" economically.

clusters.title: Munich airport forced to suspend flights for second day in a row over drone sightings
clusters.neutral_headline: Munich airport suspends flights for second day due to drone sightings

items.title: Munich airport forced to suspend flights for second day in a row over drone sightings
items.standfirst: About 6,500 passengers stranded as interior minister says earlier drone incident a ‘wake-up call’Munich airport was forced to halt operations for the second day in a row on Friday over drone sightings, with dozens of flights and more than 6,000 passengers affected.Airports in Denmark, Norway and Poland have recently suspended flights due to unidentified drones, while Romania and Estonia have pointed the finger at Russia, which has brushed off the allegations. Continue reading...
items.content: About 6,500 passengers stranded as interior minister says earlier drone incident a ‘wake-up call’Munich airport was forced to halt operations for the second day in a row on Friday over drone sightings, with dozens of flights and more than 6,000 passengers affected.Airports in Denmark, Norway and Poland have recently suspended flights due to unidentified drones, while Romania and Estonia have pointed the finger at Russia, which has brushed off the allegations. Continue reading...

items.title: Munich airport grounded by drone sightings for second day running
items.standfirst: Munich airport was forced to suspend operations for a second consecutive day on Friday after drones were spotted near its runways, disrupting dozens of flights and leaving thousands of passengers stranded. The incidents come amid a wave of drone sightings across Europe, raising concerns about potential spillover from Russia’s war in Ukraine.

items.standfirst: The attack forced the company to halt production at most of its 30 factories nationwide, including those producing its signature beerThe Asahi group, Japan’s biggest brewery, is reportedly just days away from running out of its most popular beer, as it struggles to recover from a cyber-attack that caused a system outage.The ransomware attack, reported on Monday, forced the company to halt production at most of its 30 factories nationwide, including those producing it signature mass-market lager Asahi Super Dry. items.title: Hegseth says four killed in US strike on alleged drug boat off Venezuelan coast
items.standfirst: Pentagon chief says strike – fourth by US military in recent weeks – targeted boat with ‘substantial amounts’ of drugsThe United States carried out a strike against an alleged drug-trafficking boat on Friday that killed four people, US defense secretary Pete Hegseth said, a day after the Trump administration told Congress it was entering a new “non-international armed conflict” with cartels.The strike, which Hegseth said he directed on Donald Trump’s orders, appears to be at least the fourth in recent weeks. Hegseth gave few details about the boat or the evidence that it was carrying narcotics, other than saying the US had confirmed it was carrying drugs. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: Protest vessel intercepted in the early hours of Friday morning 42.5 nautical miles from the coast of GazaThe last boat of the 42 vessels in the Gaza humanitarian flotillathat sought to breach Israel’s 16-year maritime blockade has been intercepted by Israeli forces.A live stream from the Global Sumud Flotilla (GSF) had late on Thursday evening shown the Polish-flagged sailing boat Marinette still “sailing strong towards Gaza” after the Israeli government claimed to have halted the flotilla carrying about 500 parliamentarians, lawyers and activists including Greta Thunberg. items.content: Protest vessel intercepted in the early hours of Friday morning 42.5 nautical miles from the coast of GazaThe last boat of the 42 vessels in the Gaza humanitarian flotillathat sought to breach Israel’s 16-year maritime blockade has been intercepted by Israeli forces.A live stream from the Global Sumud Flotilla (GSF) had late on Thursday evening shown the Polish-flagged sailing boat Marinette still “sailing strong towards Gaza” after the Israeli government claimed to have halted the flotilla carrying about 500 parliamentarians, lawyers and activists including Greta Thunberg. Continue reading...

items.title: Israel stops 41 boats in aid flotilla with one ‘still sailing strong’
items.standfirst: Activists from Global Sumud flotilla including Greta Thunberg arrested as final boat is presumed intercepted in Palestinian watersIsrael says it has stopped a pro-Palestinian flotilla carrying aid from reaching Gaza, with its navy intercepting all but one of the vessels trying to breach the blockade.Of the 42 vessels being tracked online by the Global Sumud flotilla (GSF), 41 were listed as having been confirmed or assumed to have been stopped by Israeli forces. Continue reading...
items.content: Activists from Global Sumud flotilla including Greta Thunberg arrested as final boat is presumed intercepted in Palestinian watersIsrael says it has stopped a pro-Palestinian flotilla carrying aid from reaching Gaza, with its navy intercepting all but one of the vessels trying to breach the blockade.Of the 42 vessels being tracked online by the Global Sumud flotilla (GSF), 41 were listed as having been confirmed or assumed to have been stopped by Israeli forces. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The Israeli military intercepted the final boat of an aid flotilla.
The flotilla was attempting to reach the blockaded Gaza Strip.
Greta Thunberg was among the activists detained.
The flotilla consisted of 42 vessels.
Israel has maintained a maritime blockade of Gaza for 16 years.

clusters.title: Power outage in Spain and Portugal 'first known blackout caused by excessive voltage'
clusters.neutral_headline: Blackout in Spain and Portugal caused by excessive voltage

items.title: Power outage in Spain and Portugal 'first known blackout caused by excessive voltage'
items.standfirst: A massive power outage which brought much of Spain and Portugal to a standstill earlier this year is the first known blackout caused by excessive voltage, a report has found.
items.content: A massive power outage which brought much of Spain and Portugal to a standstill earlier this year is the first known blackout caused by excessive voltage, a report has found.

items.title: Blackout in Spain and Portugal 'first of its kind', report finds
items.standfirst: The massive blackout that hit the Iberian peninsula is the first known blackout caused by overvoltage.
items.content: The massive blackout that hit the Iberian peninsula is the first known blackout caused by overvoltage.

ai_summary: A power outage in Spain and Portugal was caused by excessive voltage.
The blackout brought much of Spain and Portugal to a standstill.
A report found this was the first known blackout of its kind.
The blackout occurred earlier this year.
The report analyzed the cause of the blackout.

clusters.title: Treasure hunters discover $1m in silver and gold coins off Florida coast
clusters.neutral_headline: Treasure hunters discover $1 million in coins off Florida

items.title: Treasure hunters discover $1m in silver and gold coins off Florida coast
items.standfirst: Valuables were being transported in 1715 from American colonies when a hurricane wrecked a Spanish fleetHidden beneath the turquoise waters off a stretch of Florida known as the “treasure coast”, a team of divers from a shipwreck salvage company have uncovered exactly that – a load of long-lost Spanish treasure they estimate is worth $1m.More than 1,000 silver and gold coins thought to be minted in the Spanish colonies where Bolivia, Mexico and Peru now sit were uncovered this summer off Florida’s Atlantic coast, 1715 Fleet-Queens Jewels LLC announced this week. Continue reading...
items.content: Valuables were being transported in 1715 from American colonies when a hurricane wrecked a Spanish fleetHidden beneath the turquoise waters off a stretch of Florida known as the “treasure coast”, a team of divers from a shipwreck salvage company have uncovered exactly that – a load of long-lost Spanish treasure they estimate is worth $1m.More than 1,000 silver and gold coins thought to be minted in the Spanish colonies where Bolivia, Mexico and Peru now sit were uncovered this summer off Florida’s Atlantic coast, 1715 Fleet-Queens Jewels LLC announced this week. Continue reading...

items.title: $1M worth of coins recovered in Spanish shipwreck off Florida coast, treasure hunters say
items.standfirst: More than 1,000 silver and gold coins collectively valued at about $1 million were recovered from an 18th-century shipwreck off the coast of Florida, a shipwreck salvage company said
items.content: More than 1,000 silver and gold coins collectively valued at about $1 million were recovered from an 18th-century shipwreck off the coast of Florida, a shipwreck salvage company said

ai_summary: Treasure hunters found $1 million in silver and gold coins.
The coins were from a Spanish shipwreck off Florida.
The shipwreck occurred in 1715.
The coins were being transported from American colonies.
The salvage company announced the discovery this week.
